results.title: Chuckwagon
results.creator_credit: Robert Barclay, Chetwynd Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Produced in 1964, this film is a ringside view of the chuckwagon race, star attraction of the world-famous Calgary stampede. Once ponderous Percherons and Clydesdales thundered around the course. Now they are racers, and it takes a firm hand to guide such horsepower. “Chuckwagon” brings to the screen an exciting account of this extraordinary event. (Award: Cragnasco)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Barclay, Chetwynd Films and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Chromosomes of man
results.brief_description: Methods of preparing cells for chromosome study in the laboratory. Photomicrography of cell division shows how chromosomes split and build up two daughter sets with the same number of chromosomes. The film also shows abnormal arrangements and concludes with the analysis used in studies of cancer.

results.title: A Christmas fantasy
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film depicts impressions of the lights of Christmas as they transform a winter’s night. Captures the illusive magic of a northern Christmas when fresh snow lies softly on pine trees and roof tops and multi-coloured lights glow on surfaces of purest white. The myriad lights of a city, the wonder on children’s faces, lyrical music, dramatic colour effects with trick photography - all combine to create the nostalgic mood of Christmas. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: A Christmas dream [English version]
results.creator_credit: Karel Zeman and United World Films
results.brief_description: A fantasy in which a little girl’s toys come to life in a dream - the toys being played by Puppets. (The film is noteworthy for the excellence of the puppet animation in the original material - for American distribution, introductory and concluding sequences have been added to the film by Castle Films, USA.). This film was directed by Karel Zeman at the Gottwaldov Puppet Studios, Czechoslovakia.

results.title: Christmas cracker
results.creator_credit: Gerald Potterton, Grant Munro, Jeffrey Hale, Norman McLaren, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A seasonal pleasantry consisting of three animation segments, employing tricks in movie magic by NFB artists and animators, and with specially arranged music. Three scenarios are presented: a rendition of Jingle Bells in which paper cut-out figures dance; a dime-store rodeo of tin toys; and a story of decorating the perfect Christmas tree. Film without words. (Seven awards, including Rome; Naarden; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Potterton, Grant Munro, Jeffrey Hale, Norman McLaren, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Christmas at Moose Factory
results.creator_credit: Alanis Obomsawin, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Children’s crayon drawings, and the voice of a little girl telling what the pictures are about, create a charming study of life at Christmas time in Moose Factory, an old settlement, mainly of Indian families, on the shore of James Bay. Incidents big and small are illustrated and described with childish candor, conveying to the viewer a strong sense of being there. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alanis Obomsawin, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Chorus and principals on stage please: the making of Lakme
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Malcolm Otton, Film Australia and Opera Australia
results.brief_description: This compelling film of interest to opera lovers features Australian stars Joan Sutherland and Richard Bonynge. We are taken behind the Sydney Opera House curtain to explore many of the preparations required to stage such an opera as “Lakme”. With shooting undertaken in Sydney and New York, the film leaves a lively impression of the problems of running an opera. Features the Australian Opera, the Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra and the Dance Company of New South Wales. Script by Caroline Jones and Damien Parer as Unit Manager.

results.title: The Chordates Diversity in Structure
results.brief_description: Basic characteristics that relate all chordates, from tiny tunicates to world-ruling primates, are explained. Also describes the diversity and adaptations of vertebrates, the most advanced chordates, with special reference to the relationship between structure and potential for survival

results.title: Chopin
results.creator_credit: Jean Mitry, Theodora Olembert and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: An appraisal of Chopin’s life and work. By original photographs and engravings we follow the composer’s tumultuous experiences in Poland, France, England and Scotland at a time of revolution and change. The selection of works played in this film by the Polish pianist Malcuzynski demonstrates the composer’s influence on the development of pianoforte technique; an influence which has given him a permanent place in history. Commentary by Pierre Gascan and spoken by Peter Coke.
